AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Carlos Martinez-Romero: Defendant in a marijuana possession case, driver of the crew-cab truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the crew-cab truck used by Carlos Martin: Vehicle stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent David Fitzgerald during an investigatory stop, modified with no backseat, indicative of potential smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the trial court in the case of Carlos Ma: Court where Carlos Martinez-Romero was found guilty of possession and sentenced to seven years imprisonment, and where the credibility of witnesses at suppression hearings is judged
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent David: Agent who conducted the investigatory stop of Carlos Martinez-Romero and testified as a witness, with four years of experience
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Carlos Martinez-Romero's rear-view mirro: Rear-view mirror in the crew-cab truck used by Carlos Martinez-Romero to glance at following vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the wheel of the crew-cab truck used by: Wheel of the vehicle driven by Carlos Martinez-Romero during the investigatory stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the door jamb of the crew-cab truck used: Door jamb of the crew-cab truck where Carlos Martinez-Romero attempted to hide from view
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the front door of the crew-cab truck use: Front door of the vehicle from which Carlos Martinez-Romero attempted to position himself away from view
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the modified backseat of the crew-cab tr: Backseat area that was missing, raising suspicion for smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the missing back seat of the crew-cab tr: Back seat area that was not present in the vehicle, consistent with smuggling modifications
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the back seat area of the crew-cab truck: Area where smugglers often hide, according to Agent David Fitzgerald's experience
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Justice Catherine Stone: Justice who authored the opinion affirming the trial court's judgment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals: Court that established a new reasonableness standard in evaluating roving patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the Woods totality of the circumstances: Standard used to evaluate reasonable suspicion for investigatory stops
